result.execSummary:
The defendant Chief C. Soman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

May not consume/possess any alcohol.

May not enter into any bars/taverns.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA meeting per week.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Chief C. Soman in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:24 PM. State - resolved - defendant would plead g/nc to count #1 as alleged and #3 as allged, count #2 - DRI, #4 - amend to county odinance of DC with a $500.00 fine plus costs, on counts #1 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: court costs - paid thru probation, AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol, no entry into any taverns, bars or Class B establishments, employment/school, 100 hours of community service. Joy and Soman agree. Court dismisses and reads in count #2, Court amends count #4 to county ordinance of DC, pleads NC, finds G, fine of $500.00 plus costs totalling $834.50 - take bond posted - 60 DTP/CO. Soman pleads NC to counts #1 and #3 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation. Joy - follow recommendation. Soman makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #3, withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: court costs - paid thru probation, AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 100 hours of community service, attend at least one AA/NA or similar program each week, submit DNA sample with expunction rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 9, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial on November 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on September 28, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Chief C. Soman in court with attorney Jeffery Joy who appears telephonically with leave of the Court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:38 AM. Soman and Joy have complaint, has gone over it with the defendant, waives further reading, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court continues $500.00 bond, sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 28, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
